buildup.text: Long-term memory comes in types: episodic (events), semantic (facts), and procedural (skills like riding a bike).

discovery.text: Memories are stored as networks of connected neurons. The more connections a memory has, the easier it is to retrieve.

twist.text: Every time you recall a memory, you slightly alter it. Your most vivid memories may be your most distorted.

punchline.text: You never forget anything. You just lose the path back to it.
